feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Pimcore 6prior to 6.3.0 has XSS in the translations grid because bundles/AdminBundle/Resources/public/js/pimcore/settings/translations.js mishandles certain HTML elements.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-18656
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/ca036e9f86bb5cdb3dac0930ec131e5f35e26c5f
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-65p8-5423-fw3x

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM HTML Injection
entry.content:
There is HTML Injection in the Note field in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 10.0.2 via user/note.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17223
  • https://medium.com/@k43p/cve-2019-17223-stored-html-injection-dolibarr-crm-erp-ad1e064d0ca5
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/c7736dde41826ac6eca3e838e57eab2f0304e256
  • https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PHP-DOLIBARRDOLIBARR-473217
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3264-65pg-5xm4

entry.title: [sjbr/sr-freecap] sr_freecap for Typo3 RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
The sr_freecap (aka freeCap CAPTCHA) extension 2.4.5 and below and 2.5.2 and below for TYPO3 fails to sanitize user input, which allows execution of arbitrary Extbase actions, resulting in Remote Code Execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16699
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/sr_freecap
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-018/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-598p-rv6p-g7qc

entry.title: [sfroemken/url_redirect] url_redirect for Typo3 SQLi Vulnerability
entry.content:
The url_redirect (aka URL redirect) extension through 1.2.1 for TYPO3 fails to properly sanitize user input and is susceptible to SQL Injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16682
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/url_redirect/
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-015/
  • https://github.com/froemken/url_redirect/commit/91cc8da2cf122eff0ecca14e9919ece7fca0a053
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hcpv-xh8q-f3vq

entry.title: [directmailteam/direct-mail] direct_mail for Typo3 sensitive data exposure
entry.content:
The direct_mail (aka Direct Mail) extension through 5.2.2 for TYPO3 has a missing access check in the backend module, allowing a user (with restricted permissions to the fe_users table) to view and export data of frontend users who are subscribed to a newsletter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16698
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/direct_mail
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-016/
  • https://github.com/kartolo/direct_mail/commit/3a70924777294c7fb40e9f6eb3f7627bac58dfd1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j2w4-45qm-r674

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Craft CMS before 3.3.8 has stored XSS via a name field. This field is mishandled during site deletion.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17496
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/commit/0ee66d29281af2b6c4f866e1437842c61983a672
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/blob/develop/CHANGELOG-v3.md#338---2019-10-09
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f3xr-q258-h7m9

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SQLi Vulnerability
entry.content:
An unauthenticated user can execute SQL statements that allow arbitrary read access to the underlying database, which causes sensitive data leakage. This issue is fixed in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7139
  • https://www.ambionics.io/blog/magento-sqli
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4j6w-9rf8-hg7r

entry.title: [joomla/joomla-cms] Joomla! XSS in Default Templates
entry.content:
In Joomla! 3.x before 3.9.12, inadequate escaping allowed XSS attacks using the logo parameter of the default templates.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16725
  • https://developer.joomla.org/security-centre/791-20190901-core-xss-in-logo-parameter-of-default-templates.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v84j-vh7x-g7j6

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon Does Not Set HTTPOnly Flag
entry.content:
In Centreon VM through 19.04.3, the cookie configuration within the Apache HTTP Server does not protect against theft because the HTTPOnly flag is not set.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17104
  • https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/08/1
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/issues/7097
  • https://docs.centreon.com/current/en/administration/secure-platform.html#securing-the-apache-web-server
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j224-7qr4-8646

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Access Control Bypass
entry.content:
An access control bypass vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An unauthenticated user can bypass access controls via REST API calls to assign themselves to an arbitrary company, thereby gaining read access to potentially confidental information.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7950
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2fhr-f6q6-c4p2

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Information Leak
entry.content:
An information leakage vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. A SOAP web service endpoint does not properly enforce parameters related to access control. This could be abused to leak customer information via crafted SOAP requests.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7951
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5j25-5hjr-w7m2

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-cite scripting vulnerability exists in Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An authenticated user with privileges to modify currency symbols can inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7945
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c45w-p293-7cv6

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-cite scripting vulnerability exists in Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An authenticated user with privileges to modify currency symbols can inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7945
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
